author: Staff Reporter
text:
An FIR has been registered against the head constable of Pennagaram station here for sexual harassment of a Dalit woman.

The FIR was registered based on the complaint of a 20-year-old woman, belonging to Arunthathiyar community, in Krishnapuram. The accused Saravanan, 40, a head constable in Pennagaram police station, and a neighbour of the complainant, had allegedly harassed the woman by splattering water on her, while she was passing by his house. The man had also followed the woman to a shop nearby, where an altercation followed.

When contacted, Superintendent of Police J. Loganathan said, the complaint was received on February 19, a day after the incident, and the FIR was filed immediately.

The FIR was registered under Sections 294 B, 354 and 4 of the Tamil Nadu Women Harassment Act.

However, the Tamil Nadu Untouchability Eradication Front has called for invoking SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

According to Mr. Loganathan, the complaint did not state any use of caste name, and the sections were invoked based on the complaint. “The accused head constable had taken aanticipatory bail already. An inquiry is under way, and the report is expected in two days. Departmental action will run parallel with the criminal action,” he said.
title: Sexual harassment: FIR registered against head constable
